info.name: Meraki Dashboard API - v1.35.0-beta.1 -Diff
info.description:
The Cisco Meraki Dashboard API is a modern REST API based on the OpenAPI specification.

> Date: 12 July, 2023
>
> [Recent Updates](https://meraki.io/whats-new/)

---

[API Documentation](https://meraki.io/api)

[Community Support](https://meraki.io/community)

[Meraki Homepage](https://www.meraki.com)


Contact Support:
 Name: Meraki Developer Community

item.name: Fetch the health scores for a given AP on this network

request.description: Fetch the health scores for a given AP on this network

item.name: Fetch The Health Scores For All Clients On This Network

request.description: Fetch the health scores for all clients on this network

item.name: Fetch The Health Scores For A Given Client On This Network

request.description: Fetch the health scores for a given client on this network. Clients are identified by their MAC or ID

item.name: Return counts of distinct wireless clients connecting to a network over time

query.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.
The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 7 days.
The time resolution in seconds for returned data. The valid resolutions are: 300. The default is 300.
Filter results by band (either '2.4', '5' or '6'); this cannot be combined with the SSID filter.
Filter results by SSID number; this cannot be combined with the band filter.

request.description: Return counts of distinct wireless clients connecting to a network over time

item.name: Fetch the health scores of all APs on this network

request.description: Fetch the health scores of all APs on this network

item.name: List The AP Port Profiles For This Network

request.description: List the AP port profiles for this network

response.name: Successful operation

request.description:
Create an AP port profile
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| Ap port profile name
ports| array| Ap ports configuration
usbPorts| array| Ap usb ports configuration

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/networks/{networkId}/wireless/ethernet/ports/profiles` | create

response.name: Successful operation

request.description:

nodes| array| List of AP ids
childNodeGroups| array| List of child network ids

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/networks/{networkId}/wireless/ethernet/ports/profiles` | aps

item.name: Assign AP Port Profile To A Ps Or Template Child Networks

request.description:
Assign AP port profile to APs or template child networks

 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------:

childNodeGroups| array| List of child network ids

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/networks/{networkId}/wireless/ethernet/ports/profiles/{id}` | aps

request.description: Set the AP port profile to be default for this network

item.name: Display VPN exclusion rules for MX networks.

query.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 50.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
Optional parameter to filter the results by network IDs

request.description: Display VPN exclusion rules for MX networks.

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

item.name: Update VPN Exclusion Rules For An MX Network

request.description:
Update VPN exclusion rules for an MX network.
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
custom| array| Custom VPN exclusion rules.
majorApplications| array| Major Application based VPN exclusion rules.

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/networks/{networkId}/appliance/trafficShaping/vpnExclusions` | update

item.name: Returns a list of all sensor schedules.

request.description: Returns a list of all sensor schedules.

item.name: Return all reported readings from sensors in a given timespan, summarized as a series of intervals, sorted by interval start time in descending order

query.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 730 days and 12 hours from today.
The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 730 days and 12 hours after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 730 days and 12 hours. The default is 7 days. If interval is provided, the timespan will be autocalculated.
The time interval in seconds for returned data. The valid intervals are: 15, 120, 300, 900, 3600, 14400, 86400, 604800. The default is 86400. Interval is calculated if time params are provided.
Optional parameter to filter readings by network.
Optional parameter to filter readings by sensor.

Types of sensor readings to retrieve. If no metrics are supplied, all available types of readings will be retrieved. Allowed values are battery, button, door, humidity, indoorAirQuality, noise, pm25, temperature, tvoc, and water.
Optional parameter to filter readings by one or more models. Allowed values are MT10, MT11, MT12, MT14, MT20, and MT30.

request.description: Return all reported readings from sensors in a given timespan, summarized as a series of intervals, sorted by interval start time in descending order

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

item.name: List The Permissions Scopes For This Organization

request.description: List the permissions scopes for this organization
Retrieve a single permission scope

item.name: List All The Roles In This Organization

request.description: List all the roles in this organization

item.name: Creates New Role For This Organization

request.description:
Creates new role for this organization.
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| The name of the new role. Must be unique. This parameter is required.
appliedOnDevices| array| Device tag on which this specified permission is applied.
appliedOnNetworks| array| Network tag on which this specified permission is applied.
appliedOrgWide| array| Permissions to be applied org wide.
Retrieve a single role

item.name: Delete An Existing Role For This Organization

request.description: Delete an existing role for this organization.

item.name: Update An Existing Role In This Organization

request.description:
Update an existing role in this organization.
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| The name of the new role. Must be unique.
appliedOnDevices| array| Device tag on which this specified permission is applied.
appliedOnNetworks| array| Network tag on which this specified permission is applied.
appliedOrgWide| array| Permissions to be applied org wide.

item.name: Provides A List Of Private Application Groups For An Organization

query.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 10.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
Optional parameter to filter the application group list by group name, case is ignored
Optional parameter to filter the application group list by group description, case is ignored
Optional parameter for filtering the list of private applications groups by the group ID.
Optional parameter for filtering the application group list by accessType.
Optional parameter to specify the field used to sort objects.
Optional parameter to specify the sort order. Default value is asc.

request.description: Provides a list of private application groups for an Organization

response.name: Successful operation

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

item.name: Creates A Group Of Private Applications To Apply To Policy

request.description: Creates a group of private applications to apply to policy. A maximum of 300 private application groups are allowed for an organization.

response.name: Successful operation
response.body:
{
 "applicationGroupId": "1122321",
 "name": "Westcoast Data Center",
 "description": "Private applications in Westcoast Data Center",
 "applicationIds": [
  "183456",
  "123568"
 ],
 "createdAt": "2021-12-13T16:07:07.222Z",
 "modifiedAt": "2021-12-13T16:07:07.222Z"
}

item.name: Update An Application Group In An Organization

request.description: Update an application group in an Organization. Updates are allowed on Group Name and Group Description. Applications can be added or removed. Group type and Policy cannot be changed.

response.name: Successful operation
response.body:
{
 "applicationGroupId": "1122321",
 "name": "Westcoast Data Center",
 "description": "Private applications in Westcoast Data Center",
 "applicationIds": [
  "183456",
  "123568"
 ],
 "createdAt": "2021-12-13T16:07:07.222Z",
 "modifiedAt": "2021-12-13T16:07:07.222Z"
}

request.description: Deletes private application group from an Organization. Detaches application from groups before deleting

item.name: Provides A List Of Private Applications For An Organization

query.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 10.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
Optional parameter to filter the private applications list by application name, case is ignored
Optional parameter to filter the private applications list by application description, case is ignored
Optional parameter for filtering the list of private applications belonging to the application group identified by the given ID.
Optional parameter for filtering the list of private applications by applications that contain at least one destination with the specified accessType value.
Optional parameter for filtering the list of private applications by external FQDN equals the given value
Optional parameter to specify the field used to sort objects.
Optional parameter to specify the sort order. Default value is asc.

request.description: Provides a list of private applications for an Organization.

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

item.name: Adds A New Private Application To The Organization

request.description: Adds a new private application to the Organization. A maximum of 300 private applications are allowed for an organization.
Updates a specific private application. Updates can be made to Name, Description, Destinations, App Protocol, SNI and SSL verification. Application groups can be added or removed.
Deletes a specific private application. Delink the application from any application groups before deleting the app. Cascade delete application group if this is the only application in the group.

item.name: Return The Details Of A Specific Private Application

request.description: Return the details of a specific private application

item.name: List the latest 5000 events logged by remote access.

query.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 5000. Default is 50.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.
The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.
An identity ID or comma-delimited list of identity ID.
An identity type or comma-delimited list of identity type.
Specify the type of connection event.

Specify a comma-separated list of AnyConnect Roaming Security module
      versions to filter the data.
Specify a comma-separated list of OS versions to filter the data.

request.description: List the latest 5000 events logged by remote access.

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

item.name: Returns the power draw over time for all switches in the given organization

query.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data.
The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.

request.description: Returns the power draw over time for all switches in the given organization. The interval size returned depends on the requested timespan with a 20 minute resolution used for timespans up to 1 day, a 4 hour resolution used for timespans up to 2 weeks, and a 1 day resolution for timespans larger than 2 weeks.

item.name: Returns the counts of all active ports for the requested timespan, grouped by speed

query.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data.
The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.

request.description: Returns the counts of all active ports for the requested timespan, grouped by speed.  The number of inactive ports, and the total number of ports is also provided.

item.name: List the switchports in an organization

query.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.
The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameter t0. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.
The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 50. Default is 50.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
Optional parameter to filter switchports by network.
Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to the specified port profiles.
Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to switches by name. All returned switches will have a name that contains the search term or is an exact match.
Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to switches by MAC address. All returned switches will have a MAC address that contains the search term or is an exact match.
Optional parameter to filter switchports by one or more MAC addresses belonging to devices. All switchports returned belong to MAC addresses of switches that are an exact match.
Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to switches by serial number. All returned switches will have a serial number that contains the search term or is an exact match.
Optional parameter to filter switchports belonging to switches with one or more serial numbers. All switchports returned belong to serial numbers of switches that are an exact match.
Optional parameter to filter results by switches where the configuration has been updated after the given timestamp.

request.description: List the switchports in an organization

response.name: Successful operation

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

item.name: Return List Of Scanning API Receivers

request.description: Return list of scanning API receivers

item.name: Set The List Of Scanning API Receivers

request.description: Set the list of scanning API receivers. Old receivers will be removed

Change scanning API settings
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
analyticsEnabled| boolean| Collect location and scanning analytics
scanningApiEnabled| boolean| Enable push API for scanning events, analytics must be enabled

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/networks/{networkId}/locationScanning` | update
Return scanning API settings

description| string| Certificate description

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/organizations/{organizationId}/certificates/import` | create

response.name: Successful operation

item.name: Query For Certificate Revocation List CRL For The Organizations RADSEC Device Certificate Authority CA With The Given Id

request.description: Query for certificate revocation list (CRL) for the organization's RADSEC device Certificate Authority (CA) with the given id.

item.name: Create An Organizations RADSEC Device Certificate Authority CA

request.description: Create an organization's RADSEC device Certificate Authority (CA). Call this endpoint when turning on RADSEC in the firmware for the first time. Calling this endpoint starts an asynchronous process to generate the CA; call GET afterwards to retrieve the contents of the CA. Note this CA is generated and controlled by Meraki. Subsequent calls will not generate a new CA.

item.name: Query For Details On An Organizations RADSEC Device Certificate Authority CA With The Given Id

request.description: Query for details on an organization's RADSEC device Certificate Authority (CA) with the given id. This API returns the status of the CA as well as the contents of the CA, if it's been generated.

item.name: Query For Details On The Organizations RADSEC Device Certificate Authority Certificates C As

request.description: Query for details on the organization's RADSEC device Certificate Authority certificates (CAs). The primary CA signs all the certificates that devices present when establishing a secure connection to RADIUS servers via RADSEC protocol. This API returns an array of the status of all of the CAs as well as their contents, if they've been generated. An organization will have at most one CA unless the CA is being rotated.

item.name: Update An Organizations RADSEC Device Certificate Authority CA State

request.description: Update an organization's RADSEC device Certificate Authority (CA) state. Note this CA is generated and controlled by Meraki. Call this endpoint to update the state to "trusted", at which point Meraki will generate device certificates. "trusted" means the CA is placed on your RADSEC server(s) and devices establishing a secure connection using certs signed by this CA will pass verification.

item.name: Delete A Certificate For An Organization

request.description: Delete a certificate for an organization

item.name: Gets All Or Specific Certificates For An Organization

query.description: List of ids for specific certificate retrieval
List of cert managed by types

request.description: Gets all or specific certificates for an organization

item.name: Get policies for all clients with policies

query.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 50.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.
The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameter t0. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.
Include provisioned clients that have not associated to the network.
(Required) Network Ids

request.description: Get policies for all clients with policies

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

item.name: Add An HTTP Server To An Organization

request.description:
Add an HTTP server to an organization
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| A name for easy reference to the HTTP server
url| string| The URL of the HTTP server
sharedSecret| string| A shared secret that will be included in POSTs sent to the HTTP server. This secret can be used to verify that the request was sent by Meraki.
payloadTemplate| object| The payload template to use when posting data to the HTTP server.

item.name: Delete An HTTP Server From An Organization

request.description: Delete an HTTP server from an organization

item.name: List The HTTP Servers For This Organization

request.description: List the HTTP servers for this organization

item.name: Return An HTTP Server For An Organization

request.description: Return an HTTP server for an organization

item.name: Update An HTTP Server For An Organization

request.description:
Update an HTTP server for an organization
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| A name for easy reference to the HTTP server
url| string| The URL of the HTTP server
sharedSecret| string| A shared secret that will be included in POSTs sent to the HTTP server. This secret can be used to verify that the request was sent by Meraki.
payloadTemplate| object| The payload template to use when posting data to the HTTP server.

item.name: Create A Webhook Payload Template For An Organization

request.description:
Create a webhook payload template for an organization
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| The name of the new template
body| string| The liquid template used for the body of the webhook message. Either `body` or `bodyFile` must be specified.
headers| array| The liquid template used with the webhook headers.
bodyFile| string| A file containing liquid template used for the body of the webhook message. Either `body` or `bodyFile` must be specified.
headersFile| string| A file containing the liquid template used with the webhook headers.
sharing| object| Information on which entities have access to the template

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/organizations/{organizationId}/webhooks/payloadTemplates` | create

item.name: Destroy A Webhook Payload Template For An Organization

request.description: Destroy a webhook payload template for an organization. Does not work for included templates ('wpt_00001', 'wpt_00002', 'wpt_00003', 'wpt_00004', 'wpt_00005' or 'wpt_00006')

item.name: Get The Webhook Payload Template For An Organization

request.description: Get the webhook payload template for an organization

item.name: List The Webhook Payload Templates For An Organization

request.description: List the webhook payload templates for an organization

item.name: Update A Webhook Payload Template For An Organization

request.description:
Update a webhook payload template for an organization
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| The name of the template
body| string| The liquid template used for the body of the webhook message.
headers| array| The liquid template used with the webhook headers.
bodyFile| string| A file containing liquid template used for the body of the webhook message.
headersFile| string| A file containing the liquid template used with the webhook headers.
sharing| object| Information on which entities have access to the template

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/organizations/{organizationId}/webhooks/payloadTemplates/{payloadTemplateId}` | update

item.name: Return The Status Of A Webhook Test For An Organization

request.description: Return the status of a webhook test for an organization

item.name: Send A Test Webhook For An Organization

request.description:
Send a test webhook for an organization
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
url| string| The URL where the test webhook will be sent
sharedSecret| string| The shared secret the test webhook will send. Optional. Defaults to an empty string.
payloadTemplateId| string| The ID of the payload template of the test webhook. Defaults to the HTTP server's template ID if one exists for the given URL, or Generic template ID otherwise
payloadTemplateName| string| The name of the payload template.
alertTypeId| string| The type of alert which the test webhook will send. Optional. Defaults to insight_app_outage_start.
List of source/destination traffic rules

item.name: List the availability history information for devices in an organization.

query.description: The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 14 days from today.
The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 14 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 14 days. The default is 1 day.
Optional parameter to filter device availabilities history by device serial numbers
Optional parameter to filter device availabilities history by device product types
Optional parameter to filter device availabilities history by network IDs
Optional parameter to filter device availabilities history by device statuses
Optional parameter to filter device availabilities history by categories of status, reboot, or upgrade
Optional parameter to filter device availabilities history by network tags. The filtering is case-sensitive. If tags are included, 'networkTagsFilterType' should also be included (see below).

An optional parameter of value 'withAnyTags' or 'withAllTags' to indicate whether to return networks which contain ANY or ALL of the included tags. If no type is included, 'withAnyTags' will be selected.

request.description: List the availability history information for devices in an organization.

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

request.description: List the organizations that the user has privileges on

item.name: List the Networks in an Organization

query.description: An optional parameter that is the ID of a config template. Will return all networks bound to that template.
An optional parameter to filter networks by tags. The filtering is case-sensitive. If tags are included, 'tagsFilterType' should also be included (see below).

An optional parameter of value 'withAnyTags' or 'withAllTags' to indicate whether to return networks which contain ANY or ALL of the included tags. If no type is included, 'withAnyTags' will be selected.
The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 100000. Default is 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

request.description: List the networks that the user has privileges on in an organization

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
Filter results by whether or not the device's configuration has been updated after the given timestamp

item.name: List the Clients in a Network

query.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 31 days from today.
The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameter t0. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.
The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 10.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

request.description: List the clients that have used this network in the timespan
